info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fulton and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tribes Hill, or near Fonda, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban/poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Amsterdam, Gloversville, Johnstown, Fonda, Broadalbin, Fort Johnson, Tribes Hill, Perth, Glen, Berkshire, Charleston, Fultonville, Auriesville, Meco, West Perth, Church Corners, Honeywell Corners, Stairs Corners, Young Corners and Lost Valley. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
